docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Benacerraf, a onetime president of the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Boston, shared the 1980 Nobel Prize for decades of work and intellectual leaps studying the immune system.

headline.seo: Dr. Baruj Benacerraf, Nobel Laureate, Dies at 90
headline.main: Baruj Benacerraf, Nobel Winner in Medicine, Dies at 90
headline.print_headline: Baruj Benacerraf, 90, Nobel Laureate in Medicine, Dies

docs.abstract: Dr Baruj Benacerraf, a Venezuelan-born immunologist who shared 1980 Nobel Prize in medicine for his research into autoimmune diseases, dies at age 90.
docs.snippet: Dr. Benacerraf, a onetime president of the Dana-Farber Cancer Institute in Boston, shared the 1980 Nobel Prize for decades of work and intellectual leaps studying the immune system.
